intro: Duggena thyrsoidea, commonly known as the slender thyrsoidean, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
